# ambiR

Implementing **AZTI’s Marine Biotic Index** [(Borja et al.,
2000)](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/%5Cdoi%7B10.1016/S0025-326X(00)00061-8%7D)

## Overview

The ambiR package allows the user to calculate both the *AMBI* index and
the multivariate *M-AMBI* from count or abundance data for benthic fauna
species, using the included species list.

In addition, this package includes functions to calculate different
versions of the *Danish Quality Index* (*DKI*) (*Dansk
Kvalitetsindeks*), a derived benthic index based on AMBI.

- [`AMBI()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/AMBI.md) -
  calculates the *AMBI* index.
- [`MAMBI()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/MAMBI.md) -
  calculates the multivariate *M-AMBI* index.
- [`Hdash()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/Hdash.md) -
  calculates *H’*, the Shannon diversity index.
- [`DKI2()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/DKI2.md) -
  calculates the salinity-normalised Danish quality index *DKI (v2)*.
- [`DKI()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/DKI.md) -
  calculates the Danish quality index *DKI*.

To get started, see
[`vignette("ambiR")`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/articles/ambiR.md).
For details about running in interactive mode, see
[`vignette("interactive")`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/articles/interactive.md).

The AMBI index was developed by Ángel Borja and colleagues at AZTI. For
background and explanation of the method for calculation of the AMBI
index see
[`vignette("background")`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/articles/background.md).
You can also find a link to download the original AMBI software.

## Installation

You can install the development version of ambiR from
[GitHub](https://github.com/niva-denmark/ambiR/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("NIVA-Denmark/ambiR")
```

## Examples

This is a basic example using a very small dataset, with 2 stations. In
each station there are 3 species counts. The data is organised in a
dataframe with 3 columns in a so-called “long” format. That is, each
count is recorded in a separate row.

By default, the `AMBI` function returns both the AMBI results *and* a
list of which AMBI groups species names in input data were assigned to.
Here, we also use the argument `format_pct` to show the estimated
fractions as percentages. See the function documentation for more
details:
[`AMBI()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/AMBI.md).

``` r
library(ambiR)

df <- data.frame(station = c("1","1","1","2","2","2"),
                 species = c("Acidostoma neglectum",
                             "Acrocirrus validus",
                             "Capitella nonatoi",
                             "Acteocina bullata",
                             "Austrohelice crassa",
                             "Capitella nonatoi"),
                 count = c(8, 14, 23, 13, 17, 11))

AMBI(df, by = c("station"), format_pct=1)
#> $AMBI
#> # A tibble: 2 × 12
#>   station  AMBI     H     S fNA       N I     II    III   IV    V    
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>
#> 1 1        5.43  1.46     3 17.8%    45 0.0%  0.0%  0.0%  37.8% 62.2%
#> 2 2        4.10  1.56     3 0.0%     41 31.7% 0.0%  0.0%  0.0%  68.3%
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: Disturbance <chr>
#> 
#> $matched
#>   station              species      species_matched count group RA
#> 1       1 Acidostoma neglectum Acidostoma neglectum     8     0  0
#> 2       1   Acrocirrus validus   Acrocirrus validus    14     4  0
#> 3       1    Capitella nonatoi    Capitella nonatoi    23     5  0
#> 4       2    Acteocina bullata    Acteocina bullata    13     1  0
#> 5       2  Austrohelice crassa  Austrohelice crassa    17     5  0
#> 6       2    Capitella nonatoi    Capitella nonatoi    11     5  0
```

Another example using the supplied `test_data`.

``` r
library(ambiR)

## calling AMBI using the test data set
AMBI(test_data, by=c("station"), var_rep = "replicate", format_pct=1)
#> $AMBI
#> # A tibble: 3 × 13
#>   station  AMBI AMBI_SD     H     S fNA       N I     II    III   IV    V    
#>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>
#> 1       1  1.48   0.338  1.80     6 0.0%     16 12.5% 75.0% 12.5% 0.0%  0.0% 
#> 2       2  1.89   0.238  3.54    22 0.0%     80 40.0% 13.8% 30.0% 15.0% 1.2% 
#> 3       3  4.12   0.884  2.50     9 0.0%     24 0.0%  12.5% 29.2% 8.3%  50.0%
#> # ℹ 1 more variable: Disturbance <chr>
#> 
#> $AMBI_rep
#> # A tibble: 8 × 11
#>   station replicate  AMBI     S fNA       N I     II    III   IV    V    
#>     <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>
#> 1       1 a          1.8      3 0.0%      5 0.0%  80.0% 20.0% 0.0%  0.0% 
#> 2       1 b          1.5      3 0.0%      7 14.3% 71.4% 14.3% 0.0%  0.0% 
#> 3       1 c          1.12     2 0.0%      4 25.0% 75.0% 0.0%  0.0%  0.0% 
#> 4       2 a          1.88    12 0.0%     32 40.6% 15.6% 21.9% 21.9% 0.0% 
#> 5       2 b          2.13    12 0.0%     19 31.6% 15.8% 36.8% 10.5% 5.3% 
#> 6       2 c          1.66    10 0.0%     29 44.8% 10.3% 34.5% 10.3% 0.0% 
#> 7       3 a          3.5      5 0.0%      6 0.0%  33.3% 16.7% 33.3% 16.7%
#> 8       3 b          4.75     6 0.0%     18 0.0%  5.6%  33.3% 0.0%  61.1%
#> 
#> $matched
#> # A tibble: 53 × 7
#>    station replicate species             species_matched     count group    RA
#>      <dbl> <chr>     <chr>               <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1       1 a         Cumopsis fagei      Cumopsis fagei          2     2     0
#>  2       1 a         Diogenes pugilator  Diogenes pugilator      2     2     0
#>  3       1 a         Paradoneis armata   Paradoneis armata       1     3     0
#>  4       1 b         Bathyporeia elegans Bathyporeia elegans     1     1     0
#>  5       1 b         Diogenes pugilator  Diogenes pugilator      5     2     0
#>  6       1 b         Dispio uncinata     Dispio uncinata         1     3     0
#>  7       1 c         Astarte sp.         Astarte sp.             1     1     0
#>  8       1 c         Diogenes pugilator  Diogenes pugilator      3     2     0
#>  9       2 a         Cumopsis fagei      Cumopsis fagei          1     2     0
#> 10       2 a         Glycera tridactyla  Glycera tridactyla      2     2     0
#> # ℹ 43 more rows
```

## Acknowledgments

The artwork for the ambiR logo was created by Steen Knudsen.
[](https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0428-9940)

Development work on the ambiR package is funded in part by the GES4SEAS
project.

![EU logo](reference/figures/EUlogo60.png "EU logo")![UKRI
logo](reference/figures/UKRI20logo60.png "UKRI logo")

Grant Agreement 101059877 - GES4SEAS

The GES4SEAS project has been approved under the
HORIZON-CL6-2021-BIODIV-01-04 call: *‘Assess and predict integrated
impacts of cumulative direct and indirect stressors on coastal and
marine biodiversity, ecosystems and their services’*.

Funded by the European Union. Views and opinions expressed are however
those of the authors only and do not necessarily reflect those of the
European Union or UK Research and Innovation. Neither the European Union
nor the granting authority can be held responsible for them.

# Package index

### AMBI functions

Core AMBI functions.

- [`AMBI()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/AMBI.md) :
  Calculates AMBI, the AZTI Marine Biotic Index
- [`MAMBI()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/MAMBI.md) :
  Calculates M-AMBI, the multivariate AZTI Marine Biotic Index

### Benthic quality indices

Other benthic quality index functions, including those derived from
AMBI.

- [`Hdash()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/Hdash.md) :
  Calculates H' the Shannon diversity index
- [`DKI()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/DKI.md) :
  Calculates DKI (v1)
- [`DKI2()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/DKI2.md) :
  Calculates DKI (v2)

### Utility functions

Help functions for quality indices.

- [`AMBI_species()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/AMBI_species.md)
  : Returns species list for AMBI calculations
- [`H_sal()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/H_sal.md) :
  Maximum H' as a linear function of salinity
- [`AMBI_sal()`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/AMBI_sal.md)
  : Minimum AMBI as a linear function of salinity
- [`test_data`](https://niva-denmark.github.io/ambiR/reference/test_data.md)
  : AMBI test dataset
